lines.gurmukhi: supn cirqR icqR joeI dyKY soeI jwnY dUsro n dyKY pwvY khO kYsy jwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Soupan Charitr Chitr Joee Daykhai Soee Jaanai , Doosaro N Daykhai Paavai Kahau Kaisay Jaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The miracle of a dream is known to the one who has seen it. No one else can see it. Then how can anyone else know about it?

lines.gurmukhi: nwl ibKY bwq kIey sunIAq kwn dIey bkqw Aau sRoqw ibnu kw pY aunmwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Naal Bikhai Baat Keeay Souneeat Kaan Deeay , Bakataa Au Srotaa Binu Kaa Pai Ounamaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If something is spoken in one end of a tube and the other end is put in one's own ears, then only he alone would know who has said or heard what. No one else can know.

lines.gurmukhi: pGulw ky mUl ibKY jYsy jl pwn kIjY lIjIAY jqn kir pIey mn mwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Paghulaa Kay Mool Bikhai Jaisay Jal Paan Keejai , Leejeeai Jatan Kari Peeay Man Maaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a lotus flower or any other plant draws water through its roots from the soil, the flower or plant alone knows about the state of its bloom, who drinks according to his desire.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMiD imly guhj kQw ibnod igAwn iDAwn pRym rs ibsm ibDwnIAY ]305]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Guhaj Kadaa Binoda , Giaan Dhiaan Praym Ras Bisam Bidhaaneeai ?305?

Shabad OS B.translation: The event of a Sikh meeting with his Guru and obtaining initiation from him is very wondrous, blissful and mysterious. The description of the knowledge obtained from the True Guru, contemplation on Him, His love and ecstasy is very strange to describe. No
